title: Asian Games, Oct 7 as it happened: Gold for Satwik-Chirag, Jyothi, Ojas; India clinch 107 medals
content:
That‚Äôs it from us for the 2022 Asian Games!A remarkable Asian Games comes to an end for India with the contingent creating history on Sunday when they won 12 medals to cross the 100-medal mark for the first time in Asian Games history. India won 107 medals in total with 28 gold, 38 silver and 41 bronze medals.Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty won a historic gold medal for India in badminton when they clinched gold in the men‚Äôs doubles event.Compound archers Jyothi Surekha Vennam and Ojas Deotale completed a hat-trick of gold medals in Hangzhou when they won their respective individual events. The men‚Äôs cricket team marked their debut at the continental event by winning gold while the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs kabaddi teams were crowned champions once again on Sunday. The men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs chess teams won silver while Deepak Punia finished second in the men‚Äôs 86kg wrestling event. The Indian women‚Äôs hockey team brushed off their disappointment of missing out on a place in the final by beating Japan and winning bronze. Thank you for joining Scroll‚Äôs coverage of the Hangzhou Asian Games! You can check our coverage of the Games here.
